This project aim measure effectiveness KIPP reduce injury improve physical fitness among 5th -8th grade boy girl Chicago public school . Specifically , aim : - Train PE teacher sport coach 5th -8th grade student incorporate 10-minute KIPP warm-up regular team practice PE class . - Measure effect KIPP sport injury rate . - Measure effect KIPP PE student ' physical fitness . LITERATURE REVIEW / JUSTIFICATION OF RESEARCH Sports-related injuries serious concern physically active child adolescent . Treatment cost substantial , time lose school sport considerable impact mental health academic performance . A handful study , include previous research CPS high school , show coach-led neuromuscular training ( NMT ) program reduce risk sports-related injury among female high school athlete 88 % . However , study NMT include athletes 14 year age , none investigate protective effect NMT sport soccer , basketball , volleyball team handball . NMT include exercise strengthen core low extremity muscle , improve balance agility , promote safe technique land pivot common sport maneuver lead injury . In 2006 , research coach-led neuromuscular training program call Knee Injury Prevention Program ( KIPP ) female soccer basketball athletes CPS high school find statistically significant reduction lower extremity injury team use KIPP warm-up . KIPP also beneficial effect physical fitness ; however yet directly study . HYPOTHESES - Coaches PE teacher demonstrate compliance competency implement KIPP exercise regular practices/games PE class , respectively . - KIPP train reduce injury school-sponsored sport . - KIPP train improve PE student ' physical fitness . PRELIMINARY STUDIES From 2006 2007 , research coach-led KIPP among female soccer basketball athletes Chicago Public High Schools find significant reduction lower extremity injury . In 2005 , conduct trial pre-season KIPP female adolescent athlete find reduction subject ' sports-related knee pain pre- vs. post-training .
